6-9.source: BC Social Studies K-9 Classroom Assessment Resource Package

inquiry_and_questioning.description: Posing questions, identifying issues, planning inquiries.

6: Identify issues and develop simple action or inquiry plans.
7-8: Develop inquiry plans with support; search for information from various sources.
9: Develop focused inquiry questions; conduct guided independent research.

6-7: Ask about origin, content, purpose; consider time and place.
Assess credibility at a basic level.
8-9: Assess value, credibility, and limitations of sources.
Identify explicit/implicit judgments and differing accounts.

6-7: Sequence historical events; argue significance; compare perspectives.
8-9: Use criteria to judge significance; analyze multiple causes and consequences; identify turning points.

ethics_and_decision_making.description: Ethical judgment and responses to historical and current issues.

6-7: Consider context; judge actions and decisions; suggest appropriate responses.
8-9: Recognize complexity of ethics in decisions.
Make supported ethical judgments; assess responses and limitations of 'lessons from the past'.

6: Form simple narratives and explanations using multiple formats.
7-9: Develop and communicate narratives and arguments using appropriate media.
Choose effective forms to communicate to different audiences.
